name: battle-megiddo
description: The first battle recorded in detail, Pharaoh Thutmose III defeated a Canaanite coalition.

name: battle-kadesh
description: Egypt and the Hittite Empire clashed in one of the largest chariot battles in history.

name: persian-wars-begin
description: Greek city-states revolted against Persian rule, beginning decades of conflict.

name: battle-marathon
description: Athenian forces defeated the Persian invasion, inspiring the marathon race legend.

name: battle-thermopylae
description: King Leonidas and 300 Spartans made their legendary last stand against Persia.

name: battle-salamis
description: The Greek navy decisively defeated the Persian fleet in a narrow strait.

name: peloponnesian-war
description: Athens and Sparta began a devastating 27-year war that weakened all of Greece.

name: alexander-empire
description: Alexander the Great defeated the Persian Empire at Gaugamela.

name: first-punic-war
description: Rome and Carthage began their first conflict over control of Sicily.

name: hannibal-crosses-alps
description: Hannibal led his army and war elephants over the Alps to invade Italy.

name: battle-cannae
description: Hannibal's double envelopment annihilated a Roman army of 80,000 men.

name: siege-syracuse
description: Rome besieged Syracuse where Archimedes' war machines defended the city.

name: battle-zama
description: Scipio Africanus defeated Hannibal, ending the Second Punic War.

name: third-punic-war
description: Rome completely destroyed Carthage, ending the Punic Wars.

name: spartacus-revolt
description: Gladiator Spartacus led the largest slave uprising in Roman history.

name: crossing-rubicon
description: Caesar's crossing sparked civil war and the end of the Roman Republic.

name: julius-caesar
description: Roman senators assassinated Caesar on the Ides of March.

name: battle-actium
description: Octavian defeated Antony and Cleopatra, becoming sole ruler of Rome.

name: battle-teutoburg-forest
description: Germanic tribes destroyed three Roman legions, halting Rome's expansion into Germany.

name: jewish-revolt-begins
description: Jews in Judea rose against Roman rule in a rebellion lasting seven years.

name: siege-masada
description: Jewish rebels held out against Rome before choosing mass suicide over surrender.

name: bar-kokhba-revolt
description: The last Jewish revolt against Rome led to mass exile from Judea.

name: battle-adrianople
description: Visigoths defeated Rome and killed Emperor Valens, signaling Rome's decline.

name: sack-rome-visigoths
description: Alaric's Visigoths sacked Rome for the first time in 800 years.

name: attila-invasion
description: The Hunnic king ravaged Gaul before being defeated at the Battle of the Catalaunian Plains.

name: sack-rome-vandals
description: The Vandals plundered Rome for two weeks, giving rise to the term vandalism.

name: rome-falls
description: The last Roman emperor was deposed, ending ancient Rome.

name: arab-conquest-persia
description: Muslim forces conquered the Sasanian Empire, ending 400 years of Persian rule.

name: battle-tours
description: Charles Martel halted the Umayyad advance into Western Europe.

name: viking-lindisfarne
description: Vikings attacked the English monastery, beginning the Viking Age.

name: charlemagne
description: Charlemagne was crowned Holy Roman Emperor by the Pope.

name: battle-lechfeld
description: Otto I decisively defeated the Magyars, ending their raids into Western Europe.

name: norman-conquest
description: William the Conqueror defeated King Harold at the Battle of Hastings.

name: battle-manzikert
description: Seljuk Turks captured the Byzantine Emperor, opening Anatolia to Turkish settlement.

name: third-crusade
description: Richard the Lionheart and Saladin faced off for control of the Holy Land.

name: genghis-khan
description: Genghis Khan united the Mongol tribes and began building an empire.

name: mongol-invasion-rus
description: Batu Khan's Mongol forces invaded Kievan Rus', beginning centuries of Mongol domination.

name: mongol-baghdad
description: The Mongols destroyed the Abbasid Caliphate and killed hundreds of thousands.

name: battle-crecy
description: English longbowmen devastated French knights in a pivotal Hundred Years' War battle.

name: gunpowder-europe
description: The introduction of gunpowder weapons revolutionized European warfare.

name: battle-poitiers
description: The English captured the French king in another devastating defeat for France.

name: battle-kulikovo
description: Dmitry Donskoy led Russian forces to victory, marking the decline of Mongol rule.

name: battle-agincourt
description: Henry V's outnumbered English army crushed the French, immortalized by Shakespeare.

name: joan-of-arc
friendly_name: Joan of Arc Leads French Army
description: A peasant girl inspired French victories before being captured and burned.

name: constantinople-fall
description: Ottoman forces conquered the Byzantine capital, ending the Eastern Roman Empire.

name: wars-of-roses
description: The Houses of York and Lancaster fought for the English throne.

name: fall-granada
description: The last Moorish stronghold in Spain fell, completing the Reconquista.

name: siege-vienna-first
description: Ottoman forces besieged Vienna but failed to capture the Habsburg capital.

name: dutch-revolt
description: The Netherlands began their 80-year war for independence from Spain.

name: imjin-war
description: Toyotomi Hideyoshi invaded Korea, sparking a devastating seven-year war.

name: thirty-years-war-begins
description: Religious conflict erupted in what became Europe's most devastating war before modern times.

name: battle-breitenfeld
description: Gustavus Adolphus revolutionized warfare with combined arms tactics against the Empire.

name: english-civil-war-start
description: Conflict erupted between Parliamentarians and Royalists over governance of England.

name: battle-marston-moor
description: Parliament's largest victory in the English Civil War, showcasing Cromwell's cavalry.

name: peace-westphalia
description: Treaties ending the Thirty Years' War established the modern state system.

name: charles-i-execution
description: The English king was beheaded after being convicted of treason.

name: battle-vienna
description: A Christian relief force broke the Ottoman siege, ending Turkish expansion into Europe.

name: great-northern-war
description: Sweden faced a coalition that would end its status as a great power.

name: battle-blenheim
description: Marlborough's victory saved Vienna and changed the course of the War of Spanish Succession.

name: battle-poltava
description: Peter the Great crushed Sweden, establishing Russia as a major European power.

name: seven-years-war-start
description: A global conflict erupted involving most European great powers.

name: battle-plassey
description: Robert Clive's victory began British colonial rule in India.

name: battle-quebec
description: British forces captured Quebec, deciding French Canada's fate.

name: boston-massacre
description: British troops fatally shot five Americans including Crispus Attucks, escalating tensions before the Revolution.

name: boston-tea-party
description: Colonists dumped British tea into Boston Harbor to protest taxation without representation.

name: battle-bunker-hill
description: American colonists proved they could stand against British regulars despite losing.

name: american-independence
description: The thirteen American colonies declared independence from British rule.

name: battle-princeton-1777
description: Washington defeats British forces in New Jersey.

name: bastille-day
description: Parisian revolutionaries stormed the royal fortress, symbolizing the revolution.

name: storming-tuileries
description: Revolutionary crowds stormed the royal palace, ending the French monarchy.

name: louis-xvi-execution
description: The French king was guillotined during the Reign of Terror.

name: reign-of-terror-begins
description: The Revolutionary Tribunal began mass executions of perceived enemies of the Revolution.

name: battle-marengo
description: Napoleons army defeated the Austrians at Marengo and re-conquered northern Italy.

name: napoleon-emperor
description: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself Emperor of the French.

name: napoleon-russia
description: Napoleon's Grande Armée invaded Russia in a disastrous campaign.

name: battle-leipzig
description: The largest battle before WWI saw Napoleon defeated by a coalition of European powers.

name: napoleon-waterloo
description: Napoleon Bonaparte was decisively defeated, ending his rule over France.

name: battle-new-orleans
description: Andrew Jackson's victory made him a national hero, though peace had already been signed.

name: napoleon-escapes-elba
description: Napoleon Bonaparte escaped from exile on the island of Elba.

name: napoleon-hundred-days
description: Napoleon entered Paris with an army of 140,000, beginning his Hundred Days rule.

name: greek-independence
description: Greeks revolted against Ottoman rule, seeking national independence.

name: texas-revolution-alamo
description: Texas defenders died at the Alamo, becoming martyrs for Texan independence.

name: first-opium-war
description: Britain went to war with China over trade restrictions on opium.

name: mexican-american-war
description: Conflict erupted between the US and Mexico over Texas annexation.

name: spring-of-nations
description: A wave of revolutionary uprisings swept across Europe demanding liberal reforms and national unity.

name: charge-light-brigade
description: British cavalry charged Russian guns in a tragic miscommunication during the Crimean War.

name: indian-rebellion
description: Indian soldiers revolted against the British East India Company, sparking a major uprising.

name: us-civil-war-start
description: Confederate forces attacked Fort Sumter, starting the bloodiest American conflict.

name: civil-war-start
description: The Confederate attack on Fort Sumter started the American Civil War.

name: battle-hampton-roads
description: First battle between ironclad warships Monitor and Virginia.

name: gettysburg
description: Lincoln delivered his famous speech during the Civil War.

name: shermans-march
description: General Sherman's devastating march through Georgia broke Southern morale.

name: us-civil-war-end
description: General Lee surrendered at Appomattox Courthouse, ending the Civil War.

name: austro-prussian-war
description: Prussia's rapid victory over Austria reshaped the balance of power in Europe.

name: battle-sedan
description: Prussia captured Napoleon III, leading to the fall of the Second French Empire.

name: italian-unification
description: The Kingdom of Italy unified the Italian peninsula under one government.
